text: Robert Sarah (; born 15 June 1945) is a Guinean prelate of the Catholic Church. He has been a cardinal since 20 November 2010. He was prefect of the Congregation for Divine Worship and the Discipline of the Sacraments from 23 November 2014 to 20 February 2021. Sarah was secretary of the Congregation for the Evangelization of Peoples under Pope John Paul II and president of the Pontifical Council Cor Unum under Pope Benedict XVI. Sarah is a conservative Catholic and is a critic of radical Islam. Sarah was seen as a possible candidate during the 2013 papal conclave and has been mentioned as a candidate again during the 2025 papal conclave. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:Living people Category:Cardinals of the Roman Catholic Church Category:Guinean people
